interests.title: Chapala Lake
interests.description: This volcanic crater lake is Mexico’s largest lake and is loved for its wealth of outdoor activities, especially its public thermal pools

interests.title: Catedral Basilica
interests.address: Av. Fray Antonio Alcalde 10, Zona Centro, 44100 Guadalajara, Jalisco
interests.description: The Catedral Basilica It is the seat of the Archdiocese of Guadalajara and one of the main temples of the Catholic Church in Mexico.

interests.title: Calle de Sombrillas
interests.address: Calle Independencia 295, Centro, 45500 San Pedro Tlaquepaque, Jalisco
interests.description: Independencia Street in Tlaquepaque is a place to visit both day and night. There's a wide variety of restaurants and bars, and you can admire the famous umbrellas.

interests.title: Cascada de Huentitlan
interests.address: Martires de la Democracia, Loma del Zalate (Ahuatan), 44390 Tonalá, Jalisco
interests.description: This is an unique experience to enjoy nature near Guadalajara. It is a special opportunity to swim into clean fresh water.

interests.title: Guachimontones
interests.description: Los Guachimontones is part of the Agave Landscape and Ancient Industrial Facilities of Tequila

interests.title: Teatro Degollado
interests.address: C. Degollado s/n, Zona Centro, 44100 Guadalajara, Jalisco
interests.description: The Santos Degollado Theater is a mid-19th-century building located in the Mexican city of Guadalajara, there are many shows done here.

interests.title: Zoologico Guadalajara
interests.address: C. P. del Zoológico 600, Huentitán El Alto, 44390 Guadalajara, Jalisco
interests.description: It was inaugurated on March 10, 1988 by the President of the Mexican Republic, Miguel de la Madrid Hurtado, and opened its doors to the public on the 25th of the same month.

interests.title: Tequila
interests.description: Magic town where tequila production dates back to the pre-Hispanic era when indigenous peoples fermented the sap of the agave plant to create tequila
